Figure 2.1: nice figure!
Reference figure code chunk label fig: prefix, e.g., see Figure 2.1. Similarly, can reference tables generated knitr::kable(), e.g., see Table 2.1.Table 2.1: nice table!can write citations, . example, using bookdown package (Xie 2021) sample book, built top R Markdown knitr (Xie 2015).

heading: 3 Standard 1 - Analytical approaches
text:
standard relates ability perform analysis using recognised techniques understanding context analysis. consider analytical projects pieces work taken business problem question translated analytical task. demonstrate understanding question, choice data justification limitations, appropriate presentation addresses question, understanding data show conclusions drawn given said limitations.Standard
Commentary Reflective Practice Evidence Provided
SP1.1 Identify tools techniques appropriate situation justify measures used. situations sometimes non-routine although precedents likely established within team. Demonstrates critical understanding (including researching) organisation health care environment.
code: What was the situation and analytical challenge? Which tools were available to complete the task? Which tool was selected and why? What were the benefits of using this particular tool? Where there any disadvantages?

heading: 4.1 math example
text:
\(p\) unknown expected around 1/3. Standard error approximated\[
SE = \sqrt(\frac{p(1-p)}{n}) \approx \sqrt{\frac{1/3 (1 - 1/3)} {300}} = 0.027
\]can also use math footnotes like this1.approximate standard error 0.0272
